name: Contemporary Global Literature
long_desc: In this course, students will read, interpret, discuss and write about novels and short stories written in English in the past ten years by writers originally from Africa, South Asia, East Asia and the Caribbean. While these works represent the large stories of economic globalization, refugee migration, and ecological catastrophe, they are crafted around the small stories of love, longing, friendship and family.We will talk about both kinds of narratives, tracing the entanglements of one in the other.Students will reflect on the relationship between history, society and culture in a global context, situating the contemporary within the longer trajectories that mark the legacies of colonialism and imperialism. This course is virtual and almost entirely synchronous barring unexpected situations, attendance is expected for what should be a lively class discussion.

custom_fields.goals: general knowledge of global issuesfamiliarity with contemporary literature
custom_fields.key_topics: global, fiction, Africa, Asia, Caribbean, race, globalization, colonialism, gender
